trans-unit.source: A simple Python GUI framework.
trans-unit.target: 一个简单的Python GUI框架。

trans-unit.source: Example Programs
trans-unit.target: 示例程序

trans-unit.source: Installation
trans-unit.target: 安装

trans-unit.source: It allows you to express the layout of your GUI in terms of Python lists and dicts, enabling a much more declarative and easy to read (and maintain) coding style.
trans-unit.target: 它允许你用Python list和dicts来表达你的GUI布局,使你的编码风格更加声明化和易于阅读(和维护)。

trans-unit.source: It lets the same high-level code work with a number of different underlying GUI toolkits. Currently supported: Qt (versions 3, 4, and 5), PySide and PySide 2, KDE (versions 3 and 4), wxWidgets, and GTK. (The original reason for writing this sub-package was that wxWidgets doesn’t use Qt and I like the Qt/KDE widgets better, but Qt was not available for Windows and I wanted code that would run cross-platform.)
trans-unit.target: It lets the same high-level code work with a number of different underlying GUI toolkits. Currently supported: Qt (versions 3, 4, and 5), PySide and PySide 2, KDE (versions 3 and 4), wxWidgets, and GTK. (The original reason for writing this sub-package was that wxWidgets doesn’t use Qt and I like the Qt/KDE widgets better, but Qt was not available for Windows and I wanted code that would run cross-platform.)

trans-unit.source: Note that the GTK toolkit support in this sub-package is “experimental” and may be removed if it proves to be more trouble than it’s worth. It’s currently included because wxWidgets’ behavior when using GTK as its underlying GUI framework has some quirks that I haven’t been able to work around yet. However, the GTK implementation of a number of widgets (particularly tables and list/tree views) is much less capable than the wxWidgets one, so the Python code for GTK ends up relying much more on ugly hacks.
trans-unit.target: Note that the GTK toolkit support in this sub-package is “experimental” and may be removed if it proves to be more trouble than it’s worth. It’s currently included because wxWidgets’ behavior when using GTK as its underlying GUI framework has some quirks that I haven’t been able to work around yet. However, the GTK implementation of a number of widgets (particularly tables and list/tree views) is much less capable than the wxWidgets one, so the Python code for GTK ends up relying much more on ugly hacks.

trans-unit.source: Note: PLIB.GUI works with Python 2.7. If you are using Python 3, see the PLIB3.GUI package, available at https://pypi.python.org/pypi/plib3.gui.
trans-unit.target: Note: PLIB.GUI works with Python 2.7. If you are using Python 3, see the PLIB3.GUI package, available at https://pypi.python.org/pypi/plib3.gui.

trans-unit.source: To install PLIB.GUI, you can simply run:
trans-unit.target: 要安装PLIB.GUI,您可以简单地运行。

trans-unit.source: at a shell prompt from the directory into which you unzipped the source tarball (the same directory that this README file is in). This will install PLIB and then run each of the post-install scripts in the scripts directory.
trans-unit.target: 在 shell 提示符下,从您解压源码包的目录下(与此 README 文件所在的目录相同),安装 PLIB,然后在 scripts 目录下运行每个安装后的脚本。这将安装 PLIB,然后运行 scripts 目录下的每个安装后脚本。

trans-unit.source: post-install script does most of the work to enable this–so you only need to override if you don’t like the default), you should not have to worry about any toolkit internal details; the goal of this sub-package is to make them all look the same to your code.
